definition: to be dispersed/to break down/to fester/to ulcerate

sentences.english: That which festers must eventually explode.
sentences.chinese: 溃烂之处最终必须爆发。

sentences.english: No man will admit his sores.
sentences.chinese: 没有人会承认自己有溃烂的疮疤。

sentences.english: Foul and festering are my sores because of my folly.
sentences.chinese: 我的创痍溃烂流脓，完全由于我的愚蒙。

sentences.english: Here the gastric mucosa has been lost, or ulcerated .
sentences.chinese: 胃粘膜已经消失或溃烂。

sentences.english: Objective To improve the healing of ulcerous wound in the leukemia patients.
sentences.chinese: 目的为促进白血病并发伤口溃烂患者的伤口愈合。

sentences.english: Other salt can't hurt yourself, unless you have festers.
sentences.chinese: 别人撒盐伤不了自己，除非你身上有溃烂之处。

sentences.english: Their udders were frequently ulcerated , but they would be milked regardless.
sentences.chinese: 它们的乳腺经常溃烂，但照样挤奶。

sentences.english: That undermines efficient capital allocation and allows excesses to fester.
sentences.chinese: 这样的做法就削弱了有效的资本配置，使得伤口溃烂。

sentences.english: The colonoscopic views of a smaller rectal adenocarcinoma, but still with an ulcerated surface, are shown here.
sentences.chinese: 小的直肠腺癌的结肠镜检图，表面有一溃烂。

sentences.english: Wounds festered in the damp, they never healed.
sentences.chinese: 伤口在潮湿中溃烂，永远也不能愈合。

sentences.english: Nodules can become canker, similar to the primary chancre syphilis.
sentences.chinese: 结节可以成为溃烂，类似于初级下疳梅毒。

definition: (of a sore etc) to fester/to ulcerate
